title: What should I do if I feel lonely for a long time? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should learn to become your own best friend. Including investing in goals and activities that vitalize you. The more lonely we are, the more our neediness drives others away. The more lonely we are, the more any relationships we DO form end up being strangled and dying. If we do not like ourselves and our own company, we will not be able to make our relationships work. Now, we ALL have some degree of internal discontent .. none of us are perfect, but others seen from a distance can appear to be perfect. Also, life has no guarantee and no certainty since change is the only certainty, so we all live with an underlying current of uncertainty and unease. The less we face and work with this underlying “existential angst”, the more we are driven to seek distraction. Pleasure, money, fame, power … love and friendships. All these distract but do not cure. And when we don’t have ENOUGH distraction, then our unease starts to burble up … we get restless and call this boredom, we become afraid of our own inner emotions and call this loneliness. We are all the same inside .. less than content, and just trying to find some way to solve that. But since happiness is a state of mind, 95% of it comes from whatever kinds of subconscious patterns we have previously fed into our brain. Therefore, it is really important what we are NOW feeding into our brain .. the way we “frame” our situation and view, and the messages we feed into ourselves. Loneliness is not bad .. if we like being with ourselves. And usually this stops by accepting that no one - including ourselves - is going to be perfect. And that while we may not BE perfect, out intentions to improve and grow, to share and be self-honest, and to act with integrity in ways that we respect .. these are what allow us to learn to like ourselves. Btw, happiness is not achieved overnight. It takes decades … but every little step towards it brings noticeable improvement, so you don’t have to wait decades to improve how you feel.

The basic state of life is isolation and alone-ness. It is primal experience that can be a double edged sword. While it is not a pleasant emotion, it is one that can fuel transformation. This transformation looks different for each person. You get to decide what you want to feel and experience with your life. If you want to continue the path of isolation, that is your choice. However, you can select a different road. Here are a few suggestions to help you along a new path: Focus on others. Find ways to help/encourage just one person a day.Join social groups IRL. There are all sorts of hobbies and groups all over the place. Me? I am part of an Iris society. Even with COVID happening, being a part of that small group keeps me connected to others.Reach out to others in forums such as Psych Central . There are several available forums which are moderated and provide a safe place to build a virtual support network.Remember: A lone mammal is a dead mammal.
